intro: Gompholobium ovatum, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has bipinnate leaves and produces pods that contain lens-shaped seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Gompholobium ovatum plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
